chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Hypotheses:


Goal:

filterlim = fun (T U : Type) (f : T -> U) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (U -> Prop) -> Prop) => filter_le (filtermap f F) G : forall T U : Type, (T -> U) -> ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> ((U -> Prop) -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments T, U are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
f = fun f : family => let (ind, f0, _) := f in f0 : family -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [_ R_scope R_scope] f is a coercion
ClassicalFacts.F : forall A : Prop, ClassicalFacts.has_fixpoint A -> (A -> A) -> A
filterlimi = fun (T U : Type) (f : T -> U -> Prop) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (U -> Prop) -> Prop) => filter_le (filtermapi f F) G : forall T U : Type, (T -> U -> Prop) -> ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> ((U -> Prop) -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments T, U are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
Hurkens.Generic.U : forall (U1 : Type) (El1 : U1 -> Type), (forall u : U1, (El1 u -> U1) -> U1) -> ((U1 -> U1) -> U1) -> U1 -> U1
filterlim_comp : forall (T U V : Type) (f : T -> U) (g : U -> V) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (G : (U -> Prop) -> Prop) (H : (V -> Prop) -> Prop), filterlim f F G -> filterlim g G H -> filterlim (fun x : T => g (f x)) F H
filtermap = fun (T U : Type) (f : T -> U) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) (P : U -> Prop) => F (fun x : T => P (f x)) : forall T U : Type, (T -> U) -> ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> (U -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments T, U are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
filter_le = fun (T : Type) (F G : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) => forall P : T -> Prop, G P -> F P : forall T : Type, ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> ((T -> Prop) -> Prop) -> Prop Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope]
filterlim_id : forall (T : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop), filterlim (fun x : T => x) F F
Record Filter (T : Type) (F : (T -> Prop) -> Prop) : Prop := Build_Filter { filter_true : F (fun _ : T => True); filter_and : forall P Q : T -> Prop, F P -> F Q -> F (fun x : T => P x /\ Q x); filter_imp : forall P Q : T -> Prop, (forall x : T, P x -> Q x) -> F P -> F Q } For Filter: Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted For Filter: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope] For Build_Filter: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _ function_scope function_scope]

SetoidList.compat_op = fun (A B : Type) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (eqB : B -> B -> Prop) (f : A -> B -> B) => Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eqA (Morphisms.respectful eqB eqB)) f : forall A B : Type, (A -> A -> Prop) -> (B -> B -> Prop) -> (A -> B -> B) -> Prop Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
SetoidList.transpose : forall A B : Type, (B -> B -> Prop) -> (A -> B -> B) -> Prop
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
ssrbool.elimT : forall (P : Prop) (b : bool), Bool.reflect P b -> is_true b -> P
ZMicromega.Vars.Facts.MP.remove_fold_1 : forall (A : Type) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence eqA -> forall f : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt -> A -> A, SetoidList.compat_op eq eqA f -> SetoidList.transpose eqA f -> forall (i : A) (s : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) (x : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt), FSetPositive.PositiveSet.In x s -> eqA (f x (FSetPositive.PositiveSet.fold f (FSetPositive.PositiveSet.remove x s) i)) (FSetPositive.PositiveSet.fold f s i)

ZMicromega.Vars.Facts.remove_fold_1 : forall (A : Type) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop), RelationClasses.Equivalence eqA -> forall f : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt -> A -> A, SetoidList.compat_op eq eqA f -> SetoidList.transpose eqA f -> forall (i : A) (s : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) (x : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt), FSetPositive.PositiveSet.mem x s = true -> eqA (f x (FSetPositive.PositiveSet.fold f (FSetPositive.PositiveSet.remove x s) i)) (FSetPositive.PositiveSet.fold f s i)

filter_forall : forall P : ?T -> Prop, (forall x : ?T, P x) -> ?F P where ?T : [ |- Type] ?F : [ |- (?T -> Prop) -> Prop] ?FF : [ |- Filter ?F]

IVT : forall (f : R -> R) (x y : R), continuity f -> x < y -> f x < 0 -> 0 < f y -> {z : R | x <= z <= y /\ f z = 0}
seq.perm_eq = fun (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (s1 s2 : list (eqtype.Equality.sort T)) => seq.all (ssrbool.PredOfSimpl.coerce (ssrbool.SimplPred (fun x : eqtype.Equality.sort T => eqtype.eq_op (seq.count (ssrbool.PredOfSimpl.coerce (eqtype.pred1 x)) s1) (seq.count (ssrbool.PredOfSimpl.coerce (eqtype.pred1 x)) s2)))) (seq.cat s1 s2) : forall T : eqtype.Equality.type, list (eqtype.Equality.sort T) -> list (eqtype.Equality.sort T) -> bool Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ list_scope list_scope]
IVT_cor : forall (f : R -> R) (x y : R), continuity f -> x <= y -> f x * f y <= 0 -> {z : R | x <= z <= y /\ f z = 0}
opp_fct = fun (f : R -> R) (x : R) => - f x : (R -> R) -> R -> R Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope R_scope]
seq.nth = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) => fix nth (s : list T) (n : nat) {struct n} : T := match s with | Datatypes.nil => x0 | (x :: s')%list => match n with | 0%nat => x | S n' => nth s' n' end end : forall T : Type, T -> list T -> nat -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ list_scope nat_scope]
N.peano_rect_succ : forall (P : N -> Type) (a : P 0%N) (f : forall n : N, P n -> P (N.succ n)) (n : N), N.peano_rect P a f (N.succ n) = f n (N.peano_rect P a f n)

```coq
intros T U V f g F G H Hf Hg.
apply filterlim_ext_loc.
intros x.
apply filterlim_filter_le_1 with (G := G).
- apply Hg.
- apply filterlim_comp with (f := f) (g := fun y => y) (F := F) (G := G) (H := H).
  + apply Hf.
  + apply filterlim_id.
Qed.
